item.title: Comparing Predicted Probability of Hepatocellular Carcinoma in Patients With Cirrhosis With the General Population: An Opportunity to Improve Risk Communication?
item.description: We compared the predicted hepatocellular carcinoma probability for individuals with cirrhosis and cured hepatitis C with the general population

item.title: Declining incidence of hepatitis C related hepatocellular carcinoma in the era of interferon-free therapies: A population-based cohort study
item.description: This study explores the impact of interferon-free therapies on hepatitis C virus related hepatocellular carcinoma at a population level.

item.title: Competing risk bias in prognostic models predicting hepatocellular carcinoma occurrence: impact on clinical decision making
item.description: The goal of this study was to quantify the bias in estimating risk of hepatocellular carcinoma for patients with cirrhosis and cured hepatitis C.

item.title: Performance of models to predict hepatocellular carcinoma risk among UK patients with cirrhosis and cured hepatitis C infection
item.description: We conducted an external validation of six HCC prediction models for UK patients with cirrhosis HCV virological cure.

item.title: Population impact of direct-acting antiviral treatment on new presentations of hepatitis C-related decompensated cirrhosis: a national record-linkage study
item.description: We examined the impact of the introduction of direct-acting antiviral (DAA) therapies on hepatitis C related decompensated cirrhosis (DC) through analysis of population-based data from Scotland.
